utterances: Actually, this one came very quickly because I got ""sense."" I thought, well, ""sense"" has two ""SE's"" and I tried to think of some combinations with ""sense,"" and ""horse sense"" came pretty quickly.
How long have you been playing Puzzle?
Well, I don't always send an entry, but I've been listening at least 10 years.
Well, you know what happens now, right?
Yes, and now are you ready to play?
Ready as I'll ever be, I guess.
This puzzle sounds a little more complicated than it is.
I'm going to give you some words.
For each one, take the last two letters, reverse them, then think of a word starting with these two letters that can follow mine to complete a familiar two-word phrase.
For example, if I said ""flat,"" you would take the last two letters, ""AT,"" reverse them to make ""TA,"" and then say ""tacks"" as in ""flat tacks.
Number one - and your answers here are three letters long - first one is Faberge.
Egg is all I can come up with.
Faberge, famous Faberge eggs, is right.
Now your next answers are four letters long.
And the first one of these is mad, M-A-D.
And it has to relate to the first word, Will?
Mad blank - something you might do if you're in a hurry, something you might make…
This is an award that Susan Lucci won.
Now your next answers are all five letters long.
And the first one is scrap, S-C-R-A-P.
Also hot topic, I would have taken either one.
Now your next answers are six letters long.
The first one of these is human.
